# AMBundleAction

**Class**

An object that represents an Automator action that’s a loadable bundle.

## Declaration

```swift
class AMBundleAction
```

## Overview

Automator loads action bundles from standard locations in the file system: `/System/Library/Automator`, `/Library/Automator`, and `~/Library/Automator`.

[doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMBundleAction] objects have several important properties:

- The [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle] object associated with the action’s physical bundle
- The action’s view, which holds its user interface
- A parameters dictionary that reflects the settings in the user interface

When you create a Cocoa Automator Action project in Xcode, the project template includes a custom subclass of [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMBundleAction]. This custom class uses the name of the project.

You must provide an implementation of [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/run(withInput:)], which is declared by the superclass [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction]. If you add any instance variables, you must override the [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/init(definition:fromArchive:)] method and the [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/write(to:)] method of [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction] to work with them.

## Initializing the Action

- **awakeFromBundle()**: Allows the action object to perform setup tasks requiring the presence of all bundle objects.

## Managing Action Properties

- **bundle**: The action’s bundle object.
- **hasView**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the action has a view associated with it.
- **view**: The action’s view object.
- **parameters**: The action’s parameters.

## Actions

- **AMShellScriptAction**: An object that represents Automator actions whose runtime behavior is driven by a shell script or by a Perl or Python script.
- **AMAction**: An abstract class that defines the interface and general characteristics of Automator actions.

## Inherits From

- AMAction

## Inherited By

- AMAppleScriptAction
- AMShellScriptAction

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
